main event: A civilian reported sighting a luminous, disc-shaped object rapidly moving across the sky in Logansville, Ohio on 31 October 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 seconds at an estimated speed of 400 mph., The object first appeared stationary, then moved slowly before speeding away., It glowed brightly, resembling many electric light bulbs., The witness used binoculars for better visibility, noting the object's oval shape., The sighting was later concluded as possibly astronomical in nature, specifically a meteor.
witness description: a 45-year-old male farmer from De Graff, Ohio
